channel.title: Can you help me change what the people say?
channel.description: Hello I need to figure out how to change what npc's say. Post here! :) Nvm I figured out how!

item.title: Can you help me change what the people say?
item.dc:creator: @Helbound Helbound
item.description:
@Helbound wrote:

it can be found in your server folder. Its name is “NPCHandler.java”, open it, and search for-

moo

The search should take you to a strip of coding, which includes the word moo, surrounded by quotes ( " " ). It should look like this-

if (npcs[i].npcType == 81 || npcs[i].npcType == 397 || npcs[i].npcType == 1766 || npcs[i].npcType == 1767 || npcs[i].npcType == 1768) { if (misc.random2(50) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Moo"; } }
The quotes are this-

npcs[i].textUpdate = "Moo";

In between the quotes is where you place the words. To find a npc to add the words to, search for the npc’s ID in the NPCHandler, and something like this should come up-

if (npcs[i].npcType == NPCID) { if (misc.random2(RAN) == RAN) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "TEXT HERE"; } }
In this command line-

if (npcs[i].npcType == NPCID) {

Is where the npc ID goes. The word “NPCID” in the code above is the exact place the ID goes.
Leave the random code strip alone, that just tells the server how fast the npc will shout out the text you put it. Remember to add this BENEATH the last breaker ( ‘}’ ) of-

if (npcs[i].npcType == 81 || npcs[i].npcType == 397 || npcs[i].npcType == 1766 || npcs[i].npcType == 1767 || npcs[i].npcType == 1768) { if (misc.random2(50) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Moo"; } }
If you need any more help, pm me.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you help me change what the people say?

Then scroll down, and you what your NPC’s say.
